results.title: The Undefeated (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Andrew V McLaglen, Robert L. Jacks and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Two former colonels, one Confederate, the other Union, find themselves in Mexico after the Civil War. Unlikely allies, the two are forced to team up to fight Juarez’ ruthless banditos as well as the Emperor Maximilian’s rampaging army in this epic Western adventure. Starring John Wayne and Rock Hudson.

results.title: The Undefeated
results.creator_credit: Paul Dickson, James Carr and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: The story of a young glider pilot who lost both his legs and the power of speech during the war, yet was determined to become an active and useful member of the community once more. The film tells how, through his own courage and endurance, and the help of others, he was able to achieve this ambition.

results.title: The Unconscious casualty
results.creator_credit: Robert Littlewood and Safe Work Video
results.brief_description: Produced with the supervision of the Ambulance Service and St John’s Ambulance first aid trainers, this dramatised didactic first aid video details the steps involved in the DRABC system of managing the Unconscious casualty. The video aims to educate the inexperienced about the crucial steps in this emergency response. No previous first aid training is required although this video can be used effectively for ‘refresher’ training.

results.title: The Uncalculated risk
results.creator_credit: Russ Nichols Productions and Filmspace Productions
results.brief_description: Shows what can go wrong when inexperienced people head down river in canoes, rafts and kayaks. Stresses that prior instruction is the best means of preventing accidents.

results.title: The Unbelievable story
results.brief_description: A small boy who is admiring a large car, is chased away when the owner returns. Later, when the car breaks down, he offers help and then tows it away, leaving the owner on the ground. When the owner gives chase, the body of the car detaches itself, leaving only the chassis.

results.title: The Unbearable lightness of being
results.creator_credit: Philip Kaufman, Saul Zaentz and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Tomas is a master of seduction. To him women are for pleasure and Sabina is the ultimate, a free spirit like himself. Life is blissfully simple until Tomas meets the young and innocent Tereza who awakens in him a tenderness he never knew possible. But it is 1968 and as the Russian tanks roll into Prague Tomas is forced to make choices; between love of his country and his yearning for freedom, between desire for Sabina and devotion to the ever-faithful Tereza. Adapted from the novel by Milan Kundera, the film stars Daniel Day-Lewis, Juliette Binoche and Lena Olin.

results.title: The UN is for you
results.brief_description:
Gives a general introduction to the UN, a brief history of the reasons for its establishment, and an overview of the functions and work of its various organs. Includes the role of the Security Council, UNICEF, FAO and the General Assembly. It is realistic in that it indicates that the UN is not able to solve all problems but that its value is as a forum to air disagreements.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Umbrellas of Cherbourg = Les Parapluies de Cherbourg
results.creator_credit: Jacques Demy, Mag Bodard and Madeleine Films
results.brief_description: With a luscious musical score by Michel Legrand, “The Umbrellas of Cherbourg” is a lyrical fantasy about the nature of true love. Featuring astonishing colour cinematography and directed by Demy to resemble a fairy-tale, the story is about a young shop-girl (Catherine Deneuve) who falls in love with a working-class mechanic played by Nino Castelnuovo. Their romance ends when he is drafted into the Algerian War and she is left pregnant and alone. She marries the honourable merchant, Cassard (Marc Michel), but when she meets her first love years later, she has to choose between the safety of marriage and the passion and magic of her true love. Featuring glorious sets and art design, this musical has been honoured as one of the greatest of all movie musicals, winning the Palme d’Or in Cannes in 1964. The ravishing Deneuve has never been more beautiful and Castelnuovo is the epitome of Latin good looks - together they are one of the screen’s loveliest couples. This version of the film is based on the 1992 restoration by the French Ministry of Culture which faithfully restores the intense colour of the original.

results.title: The Umbrella Woman
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Jan Sharp, Michael Nolin and Laughing Kookaburra Productions
results.brief_description: An innocent passion for a forbidden experience leads Daisy (Rachel Ward) into a three-sided relationship with her forgiving husband (Bryan Brown) and her husband’s brother. When small town prejudice threatens to overturn all their lives Daisy’s sexual pursuit becomes even more of an obsession as she turns her attention to the newly arrived womanising barman (Sam Neill) - with almost tragic consequences.

results.title: The Umbrella man
results.creator_credit: Ronald Fleher, Ben Park and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the establishment of an umbrella factory run entirely by disabled persons in Addis Ababa. Today, the self-supporting disabled, acquire in this pilot factory, a sense of their own usefulness and dignity. Moreover the factory saves Ethiopia valuable foreign exchange.
